body.p: To his Excellency Governor Beriah Magoffin, Your Petitioners respectfully shew that John G. Shrock late a Justice of the Peace in and for the 1st Magisterial District in the city of Covington in the County of Kenton has resigned, We beg to say that Joseph M Ransom is a gentleman of legal information, unimpeachable integrity, and otherwise well qualified to fill the office. You will confer a favor upon this community by filling the vacancy immediately, as Sqr Shrock did nearly all the business of the District, and until his successor is appointed nothing will be done,

Covington Ky Oct 26th. 1861
G Clay Smith
J. C. Herndon.
Thos Penniston.
D. C. Collins
D. B. Miller
D. Mooar
J. O'Hara Jr
F, B, Rust

I am well acquainted with J M Ransom and know him to be compitent for the place & of his petition I see that it is signed by the most prominent business men & attys of this city
